name: SKYCITY Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed one night in the Skycity Hotel on JAN 4th. The location is excellent: right in the middle of Auckland. The hotel room was ok but the bathroom was dirty so that we had to ask for the maid. There is really nothing special about this hotel but the location. It is definitely suitable for a short business or leisure trip.
reviews.title: Acceptable rooms / Great Location = just average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Skycity is an annoying tourist trap with TERRIBLE, and I mean TERRIBLE food. Room service and Fortuna were absolutely disgusting. Is bad when you can't even get chips right.
reviews.title: Not for us

reviews.text: arrived to think we were staying in a massive shopping complex but after 24 hours we got our bearings and found we had made a good choice by staying at skycity. plenty of dining options but chose to eat out. can recommend the harbourside grill just down from the hotel. this hotel is modern but manic. if you dont like hustle and bustle this is not for you otherwise its a good quality hotel with nice rooms and well located.
reviews.title: very busy but good choice
Humorous
reviews.text: After travelling both the North and South Island and staying in various B&Bs, Hostels and Lodges, we were looking forward to our last night in Auckland at the Sky City for some somewhat more "civilized" accommodations and the conveniences of the restaurants and casino, etc. This one room for one night cost more than two rooms at some of the other places we had stayed (all of which were above satisfactory). We got there a bit late about 7:30 p.m., was checked in by a girl who seemed like she was having a bad day and then assisted by a bell boy who said absolutely nothing on the way up to the room. Once we got there I opened the door and he let me stand there holding it open for him while he got the luggage. i had to ask him if he could place a peice of luggage to hold the door open (which is of course the first thing any experienced bell man would do) which he did with no eye contact and no acknowledgement. After he got the luggage in, he simply walked out, I'm not kidding you. I had to laugh. He certainly wasn't looking for a tip!

reviews.title: Good Stay
reviews.text: The room itself is nothing to write home about, pretty basic hotel room standard for $315.00 NZ. My husband, who joined me a few minutes later, and I then got ready for dinner but didn't get out of the room until a little after 9 pm. We first tried to see about dinner in one of the tower restaurants, which were either closed or booked so we went to visit the concierge for a recommendation. Who do we find minding the concierge desk, None other than our favorite bell boy. I had to laugh again.

We finally ended up having dinner in the lobby cafe. The food was expensive but edible. We did visit the casino which is at least as advertised. The next morning we checked out asking to store some bags for an hour or two while we tried to get some shopping in. This was met with a mute nod by the new bell boy.
reviews.title: Skycity Hotel Auckland is always easy to find

likes.liked: — Location - you can always find it because of the tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only good thing I can say about the service here is that the doorman helped us put our bags in the cab when we left with a smile.
reviews.title: Good hotel, Good location
Big place
reviews.text: If you want the convenience of the skycity, save yourself some money and find something close by, this hotel is not worth the rate.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 2 nights here at the start of our honeymoon after a very long flight from the UK - so we were really pleased to find a very comfortable room waiting for us on our arrival. We have no complaints at all about the hotel - it was modern, conveniently located, bright and had great parking facilities. There's plenty going on in the hotel as it's part of a leisure complex including various bars, restaurants, casino and the famous Skytower - but this is away from the hotel area so there's no noise or disturbance at all. The location is great as it's only a few minutes walk to the busy waterfront restaurants and the main shopping area. Overall, a decent hotel for a few nights stopover/sightseeing.
reviews.title: Really good base to explore the city
Bright inviting colors!
reviews.text: We stayed (Mar 2004) in an executive suite for US$96/nite and we felt that was a great price for what we received. The room was decorated in bright blues with some other colorful highlights that made the room enjoyable. The bathroom was blue tile and a big solid glass shower door. I thought the 2 buttons on the toilet were kind of neat. (1/2 flush and a full flush). The maid kept the shampoo, soap and bath gel replenished everyday. The only drawback was there was some heavy soap scum or buildup on the shower floor.
They also offer a business center with 2 internet ready PC's, phones and a laser printer (free of charge)
reviews.title: Excellent base from which to see the city
Buzzy Hotel with great Pool Deck
reviews.text: Other than that I would have no problem staying there again in an executive suite.
**Note: I had this posted under the wrong Skycity in NZ. I stayed there back in march of 2004.
reviews.title: mega hotel centrally located looking a little tired around the edges

reviews.text: Stay at the Sky city Hotel if you want to have a great location, great facilities and excellent food, staff and accommodation.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.text: We (2 adults and 2 children) stayed our last two nights in New Zealand at the end of an amazing four week trip; we had stayed in some very nice places but were not disappointed in this one,
reviews.title: Lovely big room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed one night at the hotel as my husband was attending a conference there.
reviews.title: An OK hotel

reviews.text: Check-in was done by my husband but he didn't complain about anything so I assume everything went fine. If you are a tourist staying here please be aware that it is also the home of the casino in Auckland so there are loads of people milling around. The hotel check-in is at the far right end of the lobby area.
reviews.title: Was perfect!!!!!!!!!

reviews.text: Our room was on the 4th floor and was one of the biggest rooms I've stayed in for a long while.
reviews.title: Awful, Dirty smelly place

likes.disliked: — Blood and other stains of bed linen

description: Centrally located, SKYCITY Hotel facilities are top-class, rooms are spacious and the iconic Sky Tower is right on your doorstep. Choose to dine in style at one of 20 plus restaurants, café and bars and experience the thrill of the world-class Casino. Wi-Fi is complimentary.
